voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — GO ON
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Ms. Chen, Project Manager. You're in a team meeting discussing project updates. Ms. Chen paused to check her notes and now wants to continue the discussion.

scenario.situation: You're in a team meeting discussing project updates. Ms. Chen paused to check her notes and now wants to continue the discussion.
scenario.contextText: You're in a team meeting discussing project updates. Ms. Chen paused to check her notes and now wants to continue the discussion.
scenario.conversationStarter: Sorry for the pause. Now, about the timeline for the next phase...
scenario.expectedUsage: Please go on, I'm very interested in hearing about the timeline.

examples: There is a debate going on right now between the two parties.
Please go on, I'm very interested in hearing about the timeline.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Use 'go on' to encourage someone to continue speaking or to indicate continuation.

examples: There is a debate going on right now between the two parties.

allSenses.definition: (+ To) Proceed to do or tackle STH after doing STH else
examples: Does anyone have any questions before I go on to the next chapter?

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — PICK UP
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Mr. Johnson, Department Head. Mr. Johnson needs someone to collect important documents from the client's office on their way to the meeting.

scenario.situation: Mr. Johnson needs someone to collect important documents from the client's office on their way to the meeting.
scenario.contextText: Mr. Johnson needs someone to collect important documents from the client's office on their way to the meeting.
scenario.conversationStarter: I need someone to get the contracts from the client's office before our 3 PM meeting.
scenario.expectedUsage: I can pick up the contracts on my way to the meeting.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Get or take SB/STH from a place
examples: Can you pick up some food on the way home from work please?
I can pick up the contracts on my way to the meeting.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: 'Pick up' means to collect or get something from somewhere.

allSenses.definition: Get or take SB/STH from a place
examples: Can you pick up some food on the way home from work please?

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — COME BACK
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'COME BACK' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'COME BACK' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'COME BACK' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll come back with that approach.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Return to a place or a conversation topic
examples: She came back to the kitchen with a bottle of fancy wine.
I'll come back with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: Return to a place or a conversation topic

allSenses.definition: Return to a place or a conversation topic
examples: She came back to the kitchen with a bottle of fancy wine.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — COME UP
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'COME UP' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'COME UP' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'COME UP' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll come up with that approach.

examples: She instantly came up with a solution to the problem.
I'll come up with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: (+ with) Bring forth or produce

examples: She instantly came up with a solution to the problem.

allSenses.definition: (Be coming up) Be happening soon (esp. be broadcast soon)
examples: Coming up after the news, our cooking program will feature cheese.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — GO BACK
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'GO BACK' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'GO BACK' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'GO BACK' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll go back with that approach.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Return to a place, time, situation, activity, conversation topic
examples: He washed the dishes and went back to his room.
I'll go back with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: Return to a place, time, situation, activity, conversation topic

allSenses.definition: Return to a place, time, situation, activity, conversation topic
examples: He washed the dishes and went back to his room.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — PUT OFF
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'PUT OFF' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'PUT OFF' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'PUT OFF' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll put off with that approach.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Delay until a later time or date
examples: Now that I had more free time, there was no excuse to put off exercising any longer.
I'll put off with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: Delay until a later time or date

allSenses.definition: Delay until a later time or date
examples: Now that I had more free time, there was no excuse to put off exercising any longer.
The bad smell put everyone off.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — COME ABOUT
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'COME ABOUT' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'COME ABOUT' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'COME ABOUT' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll come about with that approach.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Take place or happen/occur, esp. unexpectedly
examples: I did not expect this to come about.
I'll come about with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: Take place or happen/occur, esp. unexpectedly

allSenses.definition: Take place or happen/occur, esp. unexpectedly
examples: I did not expect this to come about.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — CLOSE DOWN
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'CLOSE DOWN' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'CLOSE DOWN' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'CLOSE DOWN' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll close down with that approach.

examples: Non-profitable companies were closed down.
I'll close down with that approach.
Non-profitable companies were closed down.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — PUT IN
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'PUT IN' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'PUT IN' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'PUT IN' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll put in with that approach.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Put one thing inside another; include or insert
examples: You need to put in your contact details in case there is a problem.
I'll put in with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: Put one thing inside another; include or insert

allSenses.definition: Put one thing inside another; include or insert
examples: You need to put in your contact details in case there is a problem.

allSenses.definition: Invest or devote so as to achieve STH (time, effort, work)
examples: I put in ten hours a day at the office.

voiceCardTypes.title: In-Context — SET ABOUT
voiceCardTypes.contextText: You're speaking with Dr. Smith, Senior Consultant. A workplace situation where 'SET ABOUT' would be naturally used in conversation.

scenario.situation: A workplace situation where 'SET ABOUT' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.contextText: A workplace situation where 'SET ABOUT' would be naturally used in conversation.
scenario.expectedUsage: I'll set about with that approach.

targetPhrasalVerb.definition: Begin a course of action, usually with a specific purpose/objective in mind
examples: We set about laying the table before our guests arrived.
I'll set about with that approach.
targetPhrasalVerb.learningTip: Remember: Begin a course of action, usually with a specific purpose/objective in mind

allSenses.definition: Begin a course of action, usually with a specific purpose/objective in mind
examples: We set about laying the table before our guests arrived.
